creator: zm_main@tut.by
text:
apr_xlate_open worked in my module when httpd started as application Apache.exe
and return rc=22 when started as Windows service

Upgrade to .45 and see if you can reproduce.  Double check the perms of
  the bin/iconv directory while you are at it, it must be readable by the
  SYSTEM (LocalSystem) account
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: What are your server root, bin and iconv modules paths?
creator: wrowe@apache.org
vladimir_garanovich@epam.com
text:
ServerRoot = f:/www/Apache/Apache2
bin = f:/www/Apache/Apache2/bin
iconv = f:/www/Apache/Apache2/bin/iconv

worked when I run Apache from command line from f:/www/Apache/Apache2/bin

when I run Apache as service or from another location
f:/www/Apache/Apache2/bin/Apache.exe -d f:/www/Apache/Apache2

apr_xlate_open return rc = 22

creator: zm_main@tut.by
text:
Worked with
set APR_ICONV_PATH=F:\WWW\Apache\Apache2.0\bin\iconv

Is this possible to read this variable from httpd.conf?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
We've made several improvements, this should be working thought I don't
have the cycles to test.  You asked about the variable, you might just
test out mod_env's SetEnv feature, but I would first have you verify
without overriding that value.

This flaw should be fixed; no feedback from reporter, so closing.

If this can be reproduced in a modern version, please reopen this report.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
